text: Oakland, also known as the Dr. Garland Doty Murphy House, is a historic house at 3800 Calion Road in El Dorado, Arkansas. It is a 2-1/2 story wood frame structure resting on a brick foundation, with a gabled roof and clapboarded exterior. A flat-roofed porch, two stories in height, extends across the front facade, supported by square box columns. It has a symmetrical five-bay facade, with a center entrance surmounted by a semicircular pediment. The house was built in 1939 to a design by David Weaver, and is a prominent local example of Colonial Revival architecture. The house was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 2019. ==See also== *National Register of Historic Places listings in Union County, Arkansas ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Arkansas Category:Houses completed in 1939 Category:Houses in Union County, Arkansas Category:National Register of Historic Places in Union County, Arkansas
title: Oakland (El Dorado, Arkansas)
